discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is the only option that will actually "prevent reinfection" of the same machine
I agree with @ronah, keyword is "reinfection same PC" therefore scheduling scans and updates for the anti-virus increases the PCs resistance to "reinfection"

comments.content:
1. Identify and research malware symptoms.
2. Quarantine the infected systems.
3. Disable System Restore (in Windows).
4. Remediate the infected systems.
A. Update the anti-malware software.
B. Scan and use removal techniques (Safe Mode, Preinstallation
Environment).
5. Schedule scans and run updates.
6. Enable System Restore and create a restore point (in Windows).
7. Educate the end user.

questions.question_text:
A technician is in the process of removing a recently discovered Trojan horse application from a user's laptop.
Which of the following should the technician complete to prevent reinfection of the same machine?

choices.A: Reenable Windows System Restore after rebooting the device.
choices.B: Research the symptoms to identify the threat.
choices.D: Isolate the infected machine from all networks.
choices.C: Update the operating system and anti-malware signatures.

comments.content: I agree UPS or battery backup also works as a surge protector, this maximizes your uptime by making your equipment ready for a surge or for power outage which damages your system.
Agree with D. UPS is the only answer specifically relating to "maximize uptime".

discussion.content: Answer would be D. Image level backup would not keep the VM running during a potential power outage. Only a UPS will be able to do that.

Selected Answer: D
UPS = maximum uptime
snapshots are constantly utilized with virtual machines which is the same as an image backup. C is correct.
B. Virtual machines uses more memory .

comments.content: d is the answer dont be throw off with the word "future"

questions.question_text:
A technician is setting up a new virtualization server, which will be initially used to host a client VM that will manage print jobs. The client, however, has future plans to utilize the server to host other VMs.
Which of the following should the technician implement to ensure maximum uptime of the client VM?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Pretty poorly worded, but B is the answer. I would have gone with C originally, but I think it means the EXACT same malware currently present on the system, not the same virus or malware that exists in general. Disabling System Restore will prevent the same malware currently on the system being removed from re-emerging.

I think its C... The technician is already in the cleaning stage. so the next step would be to schedule scans and updates to prevent recurrence which is updating root certificates. correct me if i am wrong
That system (past system image or copy) is probably infected with the malware so you need to disable it, and reenable once the malware has been taken care of

questions.question_text:
A technician is cleaning malware on a Windows workstation.
Which of the following would MOST likely prevent a recurrence of the same malware?

choices.A: Devices must match a list of allowed MAC addresses before accessing the network.
choices.B: Devices need to conform to the policies set forth by the MDM software.
choices.D: A firewall is actively monitoring the network traffic using heuristic analysis.
choices.C: Data loss prevention software will be monitoring for data exfiltration on the port.

questions.question_text:
A technician has enabled port security on a switchport.
Which of the following BEST describes the effect this will have?

discussion.content: You can limit the number of MAC addresses on a given port. Packets that have a matching MAC address (secure packets) are forwarded; all other packets (unsecure packets) are restricted.
Keyword for Ransomware "Access Code" "Encrypted" actually asking you to give out something for you to be able to access your system again

questions.question_text:
A window appears on a user's screen stating the computer's files have been encrypted and an access code must be used to unlock the user's data.
This is an example of:
